CVE-2024-3635
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T14:30:24.627000

4 posts

The Post Grid WordPress plugin before 7.5.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its Grid settings, which could allow high privilege users such as Editor and above to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).

CVE-2024-9322
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T13:32:17.277000

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in code-projects Supply Chain Management 1.0. It has been classified as critical. Affected is an unknown function of the file /admin/edit_manufacturer.php. The manipulation of the argument id leads to sql injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T12:57:17.787000

4 posts

CVE-2024-9407
(4.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-01T22:32:08

2 posts

A vulnerability exists in the bind-propagation option of the Dockerfile RUN --mount instruction. The system does not properly validate the input passed to this option, allowing users to pass arbitrary parameters to the mount instruction. This issue can be exploited to mount sensitive directories from the host into a container during the build process and, in some cases, modify the contents of thos

CVE-2024-9411
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-01T21:35:07.620000

2 posts

A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in OFCMS 1.1.2. This affects the function add of the file /admin/system/dict/add.json?sqlid=system.dict.save. The manipulation of the argument dict_value leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-01T21:32:36

4 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 130. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 131 and Thunderbird < 131.

CVE-2024-9401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-01T21:31:34

4 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 130, Firefox ESR 115.15, Firefox ESR 128.2, and Thunderbird 128.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 131, Firefox ESR < 128.3, Firefox ESR < 115.16, Thunderbird < 128.3, and Thunderbird < 131.

CVE-2024-9396
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-01T20:35:19.027000

4 posts

It is currently unknown if this issue is exploitable but a condition may arise where the structured clone of certain objects could lead to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 131, Firefox ESR < 128.3, Thunderbird < 128.3, and Thunderbird < 131.

CVE-2024-6594
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-01T19:41:08.783000

4 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the WatchGuard Single Sign-On Client on Windows causes the client to crash while handling malformed commands. An attacker with network access to the client could create a denial of service condition for the Single Sign-On service by repeatedly issuing malformed commands. This issue affects Single Sign-On Client: through 12.7.

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! Page is now live and published on their website.

  • CVE-2019-0344 (9.8 critical) SAP Commerce Cloud Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-4043 (5.5 medium) Motion Spell GPAC Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-15415 (9.8 critical) DrayTek Multiple Vigor Routers OS Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-25280 (9.8 critical) D-Link DIR-820 Router OS Command Injection Vulnerability

  38. CVE-2018-18852
  39. CVE-2017-7876

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 21.36%

updated 2024-10-01T01:00:01.313000

8 posts

CVE-2024-46293
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T19:35:06.227000

2 posts

Sourcecodester Online Medicine Ordering System 1.0 is vulnerable to Incorrect Access Control. There is a lack of authorization checks for admin operations. Specifically, an attacker can perform admin-level actions without possessing a valid session token. The application does not verify whether the user is logged in as an admin or even check for a session token at all.

CVE-2024-28813
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T19:35:04.427000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Infinera hiT 7300 5.60.50. Undocumented privileged functions in the @CT management application allow an attacker to activate remote SSH access to the appliance via an unexpected network interface.

adulau at 2024-10-01T04:47:39.943Z ##

It seems backdoor is still a thing in commercial products.

Even on 7300 Series SDN platform from Infinera - Multi-Haul Transport Platform especially for long-range optical equipments...

updated 2024-09-30T19:35:03.620000

CVE-2024-42017

updated 2024-09-30T18:31:47

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Atos Eviden iCare 2.7.1 through 2.7.11. The application exposes a web interface locally. CVE-2024-47531
(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T16:15:09.750000

2 posts

Scout is a web-based visualizer for VCF-files. Due to the lack of sanitization in the filename, it is possible bypass intended file extension and make users download malicious files with any extension. With malicious content injected inside the file data and users unknowingly downloading it and opening may lead to the compromise of users' devices or data. This vulnerability is fixed in 4.89.

##

CVE-2024-47176
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

66 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and `cups-browsed` contains network printing functionality including, but not limited to, auto-discovering print services and shared printers. `cups-browsed` binds to `INADDR_ANY:631`, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the `Get-Printer-Attributes` IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service bindi

Nuclei template

8 repos

https://github.com/workabhiwin09/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/aytackalinci/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/pearlmansara/CVE-2024-47176-CUPS

https://github.com/nma-io/CVE-2024-47176

https://github.com/tonyarris/CVE-2024-47176-Scanner

https://github.com/GO0dspeed/spill

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

https://github.com/mr-r3b00t/CVE-2024-47176

emory@soc.kvet.ch at 2024-10-01T15:23:44.000Z ##

okay here's something useful for #CUPS #RCE: https://cloud.projectdiscovery.io/?template=CVE-2024-47176

> auto-discovering print services and shared printers. cups-browsed binds to INADDR_ANY-631, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service binding to *-631 ( INADDR_ANY ), multiple bugs in cups-browsed can be exploited in sequence to introduce a malicious printer to the system.

#infosec #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:35:32.084Z ##

Red Hat security advisory: RHBA-2024:7369 - Bug Fix Advisory
See parent toots above for more details about the CUPS vulnerabilities. The rhel9/cups container image has been updated for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 to address RHSA-2024:7346
Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

Print Spoolers committing RCEs

##
threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
TomSellers at 2024-09-27T13:18:52.066Z ##

FYI for Ubuntu users concerned about the CUPS vulnerability:

Ubuntu released a patch for cups-browsed roughly 16 hours ago. If your system is configured with unattended-upgrades the patch may already be applied. I've seen it automatically applied on two of my lab systems.

As a note, Desktop installations of Ubuntu and Kubuntu appear to be vulnerable in their default state until the patch is applied. Pop!_OS and KDE Neon, both Ubuntu based, are similarly impacted in their default configurations.

Just update your packages and you should be fine.

Reference:
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7042-1

#security #cups #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

> auto-discovering print services and shared printers. cups-browsed binds to INADDR_ANY-631, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service binding to *-631 ( INADDR_ANY ), multiple bugs in cups-browsed can be exploited in sequence to introduce a malicious printer to the system.

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

Red Hat security advisory: RHBA-2024:7369 - Bug Fix Advisory
See parent toots above for more details about the CUPS vulnerabilities. The rhel9/cups container image has been updated for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 to address RHSA-2024:7346
Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177

##
TomSellers at 2024-09-27T13:18:52.066Z ##

FYI for Ubuntu users concerned about the CUPS vulnerability:

Ubuntu released a patch for cups-browsed roughly 16 hours ago. If your system is configured with unattended-upgrades the patch may already be applied. I've seen it automatically applied on two of my lab systems.

As a note, Desktop installations of Ubuntu and Kubuntu appear to be vulnerable in their default state until the patch is applied. Pop!_OS and KDE Neon, both Ubuntu based, are similarly impacted in their default configurations.

Just update your packages and you should be fine.

Reference:
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7042-1

#security #cups #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
emory@soc.kvet.ch at 2024-10-01T15:23:44.000Z ##

okay here's something useful for #CUPS #RCE: https://cloud.projectdiscovery.io/?template=CVE-2024-47176

> auto-discovering print services and shared printers. cups-browsed binds to INADDR_ANY-631, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service binding to *-631 ( INADDR_ANY ), multiple bugs in cups-browsed can be exploited in sequence to introduce a malicious printer to the system.

#infosec #CVE_2024_47176

Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

##
lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176

iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T12:39:22.000Z ##

New CUPS vulnerabilities in #Linux can lead to remote command execution via print jobs. Debian, Fedora, and RHEL are affected. CVE-2024-47176 details: https://t.co/lBdN5A4tZr. To mitigate, disable cups-browsed & block UDP port 631 until patch. #CyberSecurity #LinuxSecurity

##
secfurry@meow.social at 2024-09-26T20:51:44.000Z ##

So I just read the report on CVE-2024-47176. It should not be a 9.9.
It's literally an exploit on "cups-browsed" over 631/udp, which should not be open to the *net anyway. Like it's a nice overflow exploit, but the barrier to exploit is waaay to high. 🤦‍♀️

#infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.373Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##
lkarlslund@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.000Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
secfurry@meow.social at 2024-09-26T20:51:44.000Z ##

So I just read the report on CVE-2024-47176. It should not be a 9.9.
It's literally an exploit on "cups-browsed" over 631/udp, which should not be open to the *net anyway. Like it's a nice overflow exploit, but the barrier to exploit is waaay to high. 🤦‍♀️

#infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

CVE-2024-4099
(3.1 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions starting from 16.0 prior to 17.2.8, from 17.3 prior to 17.3.4, and from 17.4 prior to 17.4.1. An AI feature was found to read unsanitized content in a way that could have allowed an attacker to hide prompt injection.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T20:36:04.213Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.4.1, 17.3.4, 17.2.8

  • CVE-2024-4278 (5.5 medium) Maintainer can leak Dependency Proxy password by changing Dependency Proxy URL via crafted POST request
  • CVE-2024-4099 (3.1 low) AI feature reads unsanitized content, allowing for attacker to hide prompt injection
  • CVE-2024-8974 (2.6 low) Project reference can be exposed in system notes

No mention of exploitation

#GitLab #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-8453
(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:45:57.823000

4 posts

Certain switch models from PLANET Technology use an insecure hashing function to hash user passwords without being salted. Remote attackers with administrator privileges can read configuration files to obtain the hash values, and potentially crack them to retrieve the plaintext passwords.

CVE-2024-8455
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-30T12:45:57.823000

4 posts

The swctrl service is used to detect and remotely manage PLANET Technology devices. For certain switch models, the authentication tokens used during communication with this service are encoded user passwords. Due to insufficient strength, unauthorized remote attackers who intercept the packets can directly crack them to obtain plaintext passwords.

CVE-2024-8448
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-30T09:30:46

4 posts

Certain switch models from PLANET Technology have a hard-coded credential in the specific command-line interface, allowing remote attackers with regular privilege to log in with this credential and obtain a Linux root shell.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T20:36:04.213Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.4.1, 17.3.4, 17.2.8

  • CVE-2024-4278 (5.5 medium) Maintainer can leak Dependency Proxy password by changing Dependency Proxy URL via crafted POST request
  • CVE-2024-4099 (3.1 low) AI feature reads unsanitized content, allowing for attacker to hide prompt injection
  • CVE-2024-8974 (2.6 low) Project reference can be exposed in system notes

No mention of exploitation

CVE-2024-45489
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:55.343000

12 posts

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vu

There was a silly security incident recently which wasn't great but their response to it looks promising, made all the right noises about improving things (https://arc.net/blog/CVE-2024-45489-incident-response)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-23T16:16:59.628Z ##

##
avoidthehack at 2024-09-23T14:40:56.440Z ##

Researcher reveals ‘catastrophic’ #security flaw in the Arc browser

(CVE-2024-45489)

The Arc Browser is a fork of #chromium with a lot of built-in features and integrations... and requires an account to use.

Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions.

Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks.

They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features."

#browsers #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249919/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-21T18:16:27.188Z ##

Arc: CVE-2024-45489 Incident Report
The cofounder and CTO of Arc gives a personal blog post/advisory for CVE-2024-45489 (9.8 critical, published 20 September 2024) RCE in Arc. See zxy3va's blog post disclosing CVE-2024-45489 in the parent toot above.

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vulnerability with zero affected users.

This post is a longform version of the mitre description above. I started to summarize it and felt like it wasn't necessary if I just quoted the description in its entirety. Arc is making a number of changes to avoid this moving forward and to improve their communication around security vulnerabilities.

cc: @todb

#CVE_2024_45489 #arc #arcbrowser #cloudvulnerability #vulnerability #CVE

##
b30@wandzeitung.xyz at 2024-09-23T17:50:22.000Z ##

@343max Ja!

https://arc.net/blog/CVE-2024-45489-incident-response

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T16:16:59.000Z ##

@avoidthehack direct link to security advisory https://arc.net/blog/CVE-2024-45489-incident-response and reporter's blog post https://kibty.town/blog/arc/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T14:40:56.000Z ##

Researcher reveals ‘catastrophic’ #security flaw in the Arc browser

(CVE-2024-45489)

The Arc Browser is a fork of #chromium with a lot of built-in features and integrations... and requires an account to use.

Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions.

Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks.

They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features."

#browsers #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249919/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-21T18:16:27.000Z ##

Arc: CVE-2024-45489 Incident Report
The cofounder and CTO of Arc gives a personal blog post/advisory for CVE-2024-45489 (9.8 critical, published 20 September 2024) RCE in Arc. See zxy3va's blog post disclosing CVE-2024-45489 in the parent toot above.

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vulnerability with zero affected users.

This post is a longform version of the mitre description above. I started to summarize it and felt like it wasn't necessary if I just quoted the description in its entirety. Arc is making a number of changes to avoid this moving forward and to improve their communication around security vulnerabilities.

cc: @todb

#CVE_2024_45489 #arc #arcbrowser #cloudvulnerability #vulnerability #CVE

##
technotenshi@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T17:16:32.000Z ##

A vulnerability (CVE-2024-45489) in the Arc browser allowed attackers to gain access to users' browsers without visiting a malicious website. The flaw stemmed from insecure Firebase Firestore rules, enabling arbitrary changes to user-generated "boosts" (custom scripts for websites). Attackers could modify boosts to execute on a victim's browser by changing creator IDs. Arc has since patched the issue and plans to move away from Firebase.

https://kibty.town/blog/arc/

#infosec #CVE #cybersecurity #Firebase

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T15:42:00.000Z ##

trending on the Bad Place: xyzeva: gaining access to anyones browser without them even visiting a website
Arc is apparently a freeware browser. The problem: CVE-2024-45489 (unknown, supposedly assigned 06 September 2024) allows malicious users to rewrite content shown to other users when they open a page. The attack chain consists of the following steps:

  • obtain the user id of the victim via user referrals, published boosts, or user easels
  • create a malicious boost with a custom payload on one's own account
  • update the boost creatorID field to the targets
  • whenever the victim visits the targeted website, they will get compromised

This was fixed within 1 day of reporting, and assigned a CVE 11 days later, but the information still isn't public. xyzeva also notes potential remote code execution possibilities, and voices privacy concerns.

#arc #browser #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45489 #cve

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-30T12:30:32.338Z ##

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2024-0132 and allows an adversary to perform container escape attacks and gain full access to the host system, where they could execute commands or exfiltrate sensitive information. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-flaw-in-nvidia-container-toolkit-allows-full-host-takeover/

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-09-29T05:15:23.000Z ##

"A critical bug in Nvidia's widely used Container Toolkit could allow a rogue user or software to escape their containers and ultimately take complete control of the underlying host.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-0132, earned a 9.0 out of 10 CVSS severity rating, and affects all versions of Container Toolkit up to and including v1.16.1, and Nvidia GPU Operator up to and including 24.6.1."
https://www.theregister.com/2024/09/26/critical_nvidia_bug_container_escape/#:~:text=A%20critical%20bug,and%20including%2024.6.1.

#security

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T09:40:28.000Z ##

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-27T14:58:38.815Z ##

Multiple Denial-of-Service vulnerabilities in CISCO IOS and IOS XE.

Advisory:

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20455 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sdwan-utd-dos-hDATqxs

CVE-2024-20433 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-rsvp-dos-OypvgVZf

CVE-2024-20436 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-httpsrvr-dos-yOZThut

CVE-2024-20464 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pim-APbVfySJ

CVE-2024-20480 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ios-xe-sda-edge-dos-MBcbG9k

CVE-2024-20467 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cpp-vfr-dos-nhHKGgO

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

##

CVE-2024-20437
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

6 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack and execute commands on the CLI of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections for the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabi

##

CVE-2024-20434
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

6 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on the control plane of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper handling of frames with VLAN tag information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted frames to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the at

##

CVE-2024-20464
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) feature of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of received IPv4 PIMv2 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted PIMv2 packet to a PIM-enabled interfa

  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

(5.8 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

Multiple Denial-of-Service vulnerabilities in CISCO IOS and IOS XE.

Advisory:

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20455 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sdwan-utd-dos-hDATqxs

CVE-2024-20433 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-rsvp-dos-OypvgVZf

CVE-2024-20436 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-httpsrvr-dos-yOZThut

CVE-2024-20464 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pim-APbVfySJ

CVE-2024-20480 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ios-xe-sda-edge-dos-MBcbG9k

CVE-2024-20467 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cpp-vfr-dos-nhHKGgO

##

CVE-2024-20467
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

7 posts

A vulnerability in the implementation of the IPv4 fragmentation reassembly code in Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper management of resources during fragment reassembly. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specific sizes of fragmented p

#CyberSecurityAwareness
#DataBreach
#cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

##

CVE-2024-9123
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

4 posts

Integer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.70 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.838Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.124Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-42506
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

3 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

1 repos

#search_error

jbhall56 at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.441Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T04:33:25.649Z ##

CRITICAL: CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, CVE-2024-42507 -- Multiple Remote code execution vulnerabilities in HPE Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and AOS.

Advisory:
https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbnw04712en_us&docLocale=en_US

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.000Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##

CVE-2024-21545
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

1 posts

Proxmox Virtual Environment is an open-source server management platform for enterprise virtualization. Insufficient safeguards against malicious API response values allow authenticated attackers with 'Sys.Audit' or 'VM.Monitor' privileges to download arbitrary host files via the API. When handling the result from a request handler before returning it to the user, the handle_api2_request function

CVE-2024-46461
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:32:27

4 posts

VLC media player 3.0.20 and earlier is vulnerable to denial of service through an integer overflow which could be triggered with a maliciously crafted mms stream (heap based overflow). If successful, a malicious third party could trigger either a crash of VLC or an arbitrary code execution with the target user's privileges.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T19:39:29.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.124Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.000Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia

New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8

  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

CVE-2024-20496
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

6 posts

A vulnerability in the UDP packet validation code of Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to incorrect handling of a specific type of malformed UDP packet. An attacker in a machine-in-the-middle position could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted UDP pack

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

Advisory:

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-rsvp-dos-OypvgVZf

CVE-2024-20436 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-httpsrvr-dos-yOZThut

CVE-2024-20467 : https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cpp-vfr-dos-nhHKGgO

(7.5 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

9 posts

A vulnerability in the SSH server of Cisco Catalyst Center, formerly Cisco DNA Center, could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to impersonate a Cisco Catalyst Center appliance. This vulnerability is due to the presence of a static SSH host key. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing a machine-in-the-middle attack on SSH connections, which could allow the attacker to in

  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T17:04:21.000Z ##

CVE-2024-20433
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

7 posts

A vulnerability in the Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload unexpectedly, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. This vulnerability is due to a buffer overflow when processing crafted RSVP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by

https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-75169

CVE-2024-20455 : Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20433 : Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20436 : Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20467 : Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20464 : Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20480 : Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

CVE-2024-31146
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T15:32:16

4 posts

When multiple devices share resources and one of them is to be passed through to a guest, security of the entire system and of respective guests individually cannot really be guaranteed without knowing internals of any of the involved guests. Therefore such a configuration cannot really be security-supported, yet making that explicit was so far missing. Resources the sharing of which is known to

CVE-2024-40761
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T14:31:52

4 posts

Inadequate Encryption Strength vulnerability in Apache Answer. This issue affects Apache Answer: through 1.3.5. Using the MD5 value of a user's email to access Gravatar is insecure and can lead to the leakage of user email. The official recommendation is to use SHA256 instead. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.4.0, which fixes the issue.

CVE-2024-45817(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T12:30:46

2 posts

In x86's APIC (Advanced Programmable Interrupt Controller) architecture, error conditions are reported in a status register. Furthermore, the OS can opt to receive an interrupt when a new error occurs. It is possible to configure the error interrupt with an illegal vector, which generates an error when an error interrupt is raised. This case causes Xen to recurse through vlapic_error(). The re

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

itm4n at 2024-10-02T11:13:18.709Z ##

Another cool blog post by @sploutchy (Compass Security)

"COM Cross-Session Activation"

Quick read, and straight to the point. This article provides a real-life example (Google Updater service here) showing one way to exploit a COM class for local privilege escalation on Windows. 👌

👉 https://blog.compass-security.com/2024/10/com-cross-session-activation/

CVE-2024-42507
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:43

3 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

1 repos

#search_error

jbhall56 at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.441Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T04:33:25.649Z ##

CRITICAL: CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, CVE-2024-42507 -- Multiple Remote code execution vulnerabilities in HPE Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and AOS.

Advisory:
https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbnw04712en_us&docLocale=en_US

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.000Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##

CVE-2024-5830
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:36

1 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 126.0.6478.54 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T15:59:32.000Z ##

GitHub Security Lab: GHSL-2024-095: Type confusion leading to RCE in the Chrome renderer sandbox - CVE-2024-5830
Reference: CVE-2024-5830 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Google) Chrome Type confusion in V8

GitHub provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-5830: Type confusion between fast and dictionary objects in TryFastAddDataProperty in v8 can be exploited to gain RCE in the Chrome renderer sandbox. Proof of concept available

#CVE_2024_5830 #chrome #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept #poc #google

CVE-2024-20017
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T01:36:50.810000

9 posts

In wlan service, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation Patch ID: WCNCR00350938; Issue ID: MSV-1132.
